dialogue_turns.text: I know! And Senator Rubio calling it, like, a central node for spies? Wow. It’s all just, I don't know, intense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It is. It kinda highlights this whole shift in, um, U.S.-China relations. This "wolf-warrior" diplomacy, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is. It kinda highlights this whole shift in, um, U.S.-China relations. This wolf-warrior diplomacy, you know?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. seemingly has decided to meet wolf-warrior tactics on Chinas side with jungle diplomacy on its part.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Wolf-warrior"? What, like, what even is that? I thought China was supposed to be, like, super patient.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wolf-warrior? What, like, what even is that? I thought China was supposed to be, like, super patient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that was the old school, the Henry Kissinger view, um, that China played this really long, patient game. But that's not Xi Jinping.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that was the old school, the Henry Kissinger view, um, that China played this really long, patient game. But that's not Xi Jinping.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Henry Kissinger school of Oriental inscrutability peddled the canard that Chinese leaders epitomized a unique ability to conduct long-term, patient statecraft. Nobody told Chinas president, Xi Jinping, or his wolf-warrior diplomats to be patient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So he's not, like, doing that anymore? Just, uh, going for it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So he's not, like, doing that anymore? Just, uh, going for it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He’s much more assertive, confrontational. He's, uh, actively goading countries in the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He's much more assertive, confrontational. He's, uh, actively goading countries in the region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Xi had been more patient, much of East Asia would have been dominated by China within the next decade. Instead, he is goading countries around the region to resist China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then, like, Hong Kong, right? With people getting arrested for just holding up blank paper? That's, um, crazy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then, like, Hong Kong, right? With people getting arrested for just holding up blank paper? That's, um, crazy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's that urge to, uh, smother dissent. It's been common in places like Tibet and Xinjiang, but now it's really visible there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's that urge to, uh, smother dissent. It's been common in places like Tibet and Xinjiang, but now it's really visible there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Man, it just feels like everything is, you know, getting tighter. Like, where does it end?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Man, it just feels like everything is, you know, getting tighter. Like, where does it end?

dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article calls it a ratchet.

dialogue_turns.text: It only goes one direction, right? Tighter. Both sides are, uh, ratcheting up the pressure.

dialogue_turns.text: So there’s no backing off then, is there? Like, no de-escalation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So there's no backing off then, is there? Like, no de-escalation?

dialogue_turns.text: Not easily, no. And, uh, it makes you worry about unexpected events.
